Here is the extracted content from the fact-check article:

Title: അബ്ദുൾ കലാമിന്റെയും വാജ്‌പേയിയുടെയും പേരിൽ പ്രധാനമന്ത്രി മോദി പുതിയ സ്‌കോളർഷിപ്പ്  പ്രഖ്യാപിച്ചുവെന്ന പ്രചരണം തെറ്റ്

(English translation: False claim that PM Modi announced new scholarship in the names of Abdul Kalam and Vajpayee)

Content Summary:

A WhatsApp message is circulating claiming that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced a new scholarship for 10th and 12th standard students in the names of former President Abdul Kalam and former Prime Minister Vajpayee.

The viral message claims:
- 10th standard students scoring 75% will get ₹10,000
- 12th standard students scoring above 85% will get ₹25,000
- Application forms available at municipal offices

Fact Check Investigation:
- The factcheck team searched extensively but found no evidence of such a scholarship
- The government does have a scholarship program called "National Means Cum Merit Scholarship"
- A previously cited High Court order was unrelated to any scholarship
- Local government bodies confirmed no such scholarship is being distributed
- There is an existing "APJ Abdul Kalam Scholarship" by Kerala's Minority Welfare Department for specific diploma courses

Conclusion: The claim is FALSE. No such scholarship has been announced by the Prime Minister.

Result: FALSE

Sources included government scholarship websites, news reports, and direct communication with government officials.
title: അത്തരം പുതിയ സ്‌കോളർഷിപ്പ് ഒന്നും പ്രധാനമന്ത്രി പ്രഖ്യാപിച്ചിട്ടില്ലെന്ന് ഞങ്ങളുടെ അന്വേഷണത്തിൽ തെളിഞ്ഞു.
vclaim: A viral WhatsApp message falsely claims that PM Modi announced a new scholarship scheme named after Abdul Kalam and Vajpayee for 10th and 12th standard students with specific monetary benefits.
